Package data

Class FileSystem

  • java.lang.Object
    • data.FileSystem
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    public class FileSystem
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    Maintains a tree structure of FileSystemNodes: keeping both the root of the tree and the current position in the tree
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      static FileSystem createFileSystem()
      createFileSystem ensures we only ever have a single FileSystem: if we already have a fileSystem, returns it, if not, creates a new one and returns that one
      FileSystemNode getCurrentDirectory()
      getCurrentDirectory returns the currentFileSystemNode of this FileSystem
      FileSystemNode getFileSystemNode​(java.lang.String givenPath)
      getFileSystemNode returns the FileSystemNode the givenPath refers to if its a valid/appropriate path, otherwise, return null and display an error message
      java.lang.String getPathLastEntry​(java.lang.String givenPath)
      getPathLastEntry returns the last FileSystemNode the givenPath refers to
      FileSystemNode getRoot()
      getRoot returns the root of this FileSystem
      FileSystemNode getSemiFileSystemNode​(java.lang.String givenPath)
      getSemiFileSystemNode returns the FileSystemNode the givenPath refers to excluding the last entry if its an valid/appropriate path, otherwise, return null and display an error message
      boolean inappropriateName​(java.lang.String name)
      Checks if the String name has valid format.
      boolean inappropriatePath​(java.lang.String givenPath)
      inappropraitePath returns true and an error message when the givenPath is not an appropriate path (contains illicit characters), or false otherwise
      void setCurrentDirectory​(FileSystemNode targetNode)
      setCurrentDirectory sets the currentFileSystemNode to targetNode
      void setRoot​(FileSystemNode node)
      setRoot sets this root to node

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

      • getFileSystemNode

        public FileSystemNode getFileSystemNode​(java.lang.String givenPath)
        getFileSystemNode returns the FileSystemNode the givenPath refers to if its a valid/appropriate path, otherwise, return null and display an error message
        Parameters:
        givenPath - A relative or full path
        Returns:
        The FileSystemNode that givenPath points to

      • inappropriatePath

        public boolean inappropriatePath​(java.lang.String givenPath)
        inappropraitePath returns true and an error message when the givenPath is not an appropriate path (contains illicit characters), or false otherwise
        Parameters:
        givenPath - A relative or full path
        Returns:
        true if the given path is inappropriate, otherwise, false

      • inappropriateName

        public boolean inappropriateName​(java.lang.String name)
        Checks if the String name has valid format.
        Parameters:
        name - string to check if is valid
        Returns:
        true if name is a valid name

      • getSemiFileSystemNode

        public FileSystemNode getSemiFileSystemNode​(java.lang.String givenPath)
        getSemiFileSystemNode returns the FileSystemNode the givenPath refers to excluding the last entry if its an valid/appropriate path, otherwise, return null and display an error message
        Parameters:
        givenPath - A relative or full path
        Returns:
        The FileSystemNode the givenPath refers to excluding the last entry which is null if the givenPath is an invalid/inappropriate path

      • getPathLastEntry

        public java.lang.String getPathLastEntry​(java.lang.String givenPath)
        getPathLastEntry returns the last FileSystemNode the givenPath refers to
        Parameters:
        givenPath - A relative or full path
        Returns:
        The last FileSystemNode the givenPath refers to

      • createFileSystem

        public static FileSystem createFileSystem()
        createFileSystem ensures we only ever have a single FileSystem: if we already have a fileSystem, returns it, if not, creates a new one and returns that one
        Returns:
        A new fileSystem if there fileSystem was null, otherwise, fileSystem
